9. Equal rights amendment 10. Statehood for Washington, DC and U.S. territories if they choose

3. 18 year term limits for #SCOTUS justices 4. Campaign finance (like the Democracy for All amendment) 5. A guaranteed right to vote and equal representation 6. A right to organize and form a union 7. A right to free quality healthcare 8. Repeal or overhaul the 2nd amendment

#SCOTUS decisions from the last few weeks and now the vacancy has got me thinking. We need some amendments to the Constitution. Here are 10 ideas that are not completely thought out:
1. Abolish or completely change the U.S. Senate. 2. Abolish the electoral college

@MarcRPacheco @CommonCauseMA Great to see both @MarcRPacheco & @EricLesser highlight that ALEC and the Kochs have their own dangerous plan for an Article V convention. This is another reason why to support the amendment to take the convention call out of the bill! Don't give into the Kochs!
#mapoli

Senator @MarcRPacheco notes that @CommonCauseMA is one of the most trusted money in politics reform groups in the state and is opposed to calling an Article V convention and that the Senate needs to take Common Cause's concern seriously. #mapoli
MA Senate Pro Tempore @MarcRPacheco announces his support for Sen. @EricLesser's amendment to strip the dangerous constitutional convention call out of the bill. #MApoli https://t.co/BEc32JBiiS

Massachusetts State Senator @EricLesser (who just gave a great floor speech) notes many groups like @CommonCauseMA @ACLU_Mass, @LWVMA, @massteacher, @AFSCME93, & @MassSierraClub opposes a call for an Article V convention. #mapoli

That is an absolute lie by the state senator speaking on the floor. There are absolutely NO protections against a runaway Article V convention in the U.S. Constitution. Read Article V of the Constitution: https://t.co/dMCbTlTSaF
#mapoli
